name: Nederlandse Vereniging van Banken / Dutch Banking Association
goal:
The Nederlandse Vereniging van Banken (NVB - Dutch Banking Association) was founded in 1989. The NVB is the representative voice of the Dutch banking community with around 65 members, large and small, domestic and international banks. At the European level the Association is a member of the European Banking Federation and has a Brussels office to represent the Dutch banking sector in the European policy formation and legislative processes. The NVB works towards a service-oriented, sustainable and internationally competitive banking industry.


More information:
www.nvb.nl
interests: Climate Action, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Economic and Financial Affairs, Employment and Social Affairs, Financial Stability, Financial Services and Capital Markets Union , Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, General and Institutional Affairs, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Taxation, Trade
euInitiatives: The mains dossiers which the NVB is following in Brussels are the Risk Reduction Package, Capital Markets Union initiatives, the Fintech agenda and the Retail Financial Services Action Plan.
